<u>A Narration <\u> of the <u>Experiments <\u>
made June 1.1734 <s>at the Buffaloe Ta
vern Bloomsbury <\s> before several members 
of ye Royal Society & others on <u>a Man <\u> who suffer’d 
himself to be <u>bit by a Viper <\u> or <u>Common 
Adder,<\u> & on <u>other Animals <\u> likewise bitten 
by the same & other <u>Vipers <\u>, drawn up by 
<u>C Mortimer M.D. Secr. R.S. with some 
<u>Remarks on the cure of the bite of a mad Dog.
Wm. Oliver & his wife from Bath who
follow the business of catching & selling Vi-
pers offered them selves to be bit by any Vi-
per that should be procured trusting to ye virtue of a Remedy they had 
light on by change in trying a variety of things 
when <s>once <\s> ye woman was once accidentally bitten & ye
usual known Medicines even ye Oil of Vipers 
had no effect in asswaging her pains, especially 
of her breast of the same side as the hand in 
<u>wch <\u> she had received the wound. This Remedy 
for its efficacy, but 
its being readily to be come 
there being no 
house in ye country 
at hand; whereas the 
had, but at Apothe 
ed of them keep it 
presence of a great 
Wm Oliver was bit by
